description._content: Author: Unknown Subject: Smithsonian Institution Building (Washington, D.C.) Type: Photographic print     Object Date: 1977 Topic: Uncle Beazley      Dinosaurs      Snow      Triceratops      Models and modelmaking      Sculpture Standard number: SIA2007-0069 and 77-322-15A Physical description: Color: Black and White; Size: 10w x 8h; Type of Image: Object; Medium: Photographic print Notes: At the opening of the Anacostia Neighborhood Museum on September 15, 1967, Uncle Beazley was placed in the parking lot adjoining the Carver Theater, the site of the first Anacostia Museum, now known as the Anacostia Community Museum. Uncle Beazley was later moved to the Mall in front of the National Museum of Natural History and then in 1994 to the Rhino Yard near the Elephant House at the National Zoological Park Summary: Fiberglass model of "Uncle Beazley," the dinosaur (Triceratops) used in the film "The Enormous Egg," stands all covered with snow on the Mall. The Smithsonian Institution Building is visible in the background. Uncle Beazley first appeared in the children's book "The Enormous Egg" by Oliver Buttersworth Place: Mall, The (Washington, D.C.) Persistent URL:Link to data base record Repository:Smithsonian Archives - History Div View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
